intro: Calliandra glaziovii, commonly known as the pink calliandra, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, feathery, pink to red inflorescences. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, bean-like pods that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Calliandra glaziovii thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
